title.narrative: Emergency Response to support women and girls, including tackling gender-based violence, sexual and reproductive health, and empowerment

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide women and girls including GBV survivors have access to life-saving, quality, and well-coordinated GBViE response services, including lifesaving medical care and psychosocial support services. This UNFPA project 1) supports 3 mobile clinics, 2) establishes and supports 12 women’s and girls’ safe spaces and 3) distributes dignity kits to 10,000 women and girls among other activities. The project provides life-saving assistance to 175,588 people including 28,500 men, 24,917 women, 24,500 children including 1,500 persons with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency Response to support women and girls, including tackling gender-based violence, sexual and reproductive health, and empowerment

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS UKRAINE RAPID RESPONSE VIOLENCE/CLASHES 2022

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Provision of life-saving GBViE PSS services via in-person or remote modalities (hot lines, community focal point, outreach, and referral to/from health service delivery points, «safe spaces”, protection) are available and accessible for the most vulnerable women and girls

% of Strategic plans and appeals, e.g. revised Humanitarian Response Plan, including clear: (1) GBV risk mitigation measures mainstreamed throughout other cluster responses, including protection from sexual exploitation and abuse (PSEA) measures; (2) GBV-specialized programming, including response services and (3) GBV SC strategy and work plan
PP.1a Number of protection referral mechanisms and/or pathways established and regularly updated
